entry.title: Taking Gaza Would Be Possible, Sieges From Recent Conflicts Show---but at a Terrible Cost
entry.content: Israel’s planned land campaign against Hamas promises to be destructive and bloody as urban warfare favors defenders.

entry.title: Ukraine's Slow Advance Challenges Kyiv, Allies
entry.content: The country’s counteroffensive hasn’t achieved a breakthrough, and global attention is shifting to the conflict in the Middle East.

entry.title: Gaza Receives First Aid Trucks Since Hamas Attack
entry.content: A convoy carrying medical supplies and some food entered before Egypt closed the border again. Humanitarian agencies said the deliveries fall far short of Palestinians’ needs.

entry.title: America's Downtowns Are Empty. Fixing Them Will Be Expensive.
entry.content: Lonely sidewalks and closed storefronts inspire proposals to recast office districts into neighborhoods where people live, work and raise families.
